content: POSB Everyday Card M1 DBS Live Fresh Card DBS Multiplier Bank Account Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 15 Jun 2018Intending to open a DBS Multiplier account. However, I am deciding on which credit card to get - DBS Live Fresh or POSB Everyday? (I spend $300-600 on groceries, food, entertainment, EZ-Link and M1 bills). Any advice?7 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (7)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 21 Sep 2018Instead of the above, I suggest you go with this hack contributed by Seedly community members, get more cash back of couple hundreds a year. See the links below: ​https://blog.seedly.sg/cashback-hack-interest-posb-bonus-cashback-cimb-fastsaver-dbs-multiplier/​Summary: Ops for POSB Cash back bonus saver  + CIMB fast saver 1% p.a 1) Use POSB cash back bonus saver by:   (a) credit your salary ini  (b) spend at least $1 on any POSB / DBS credit card (c) Buy investment such as POSB Invest savers using Nikkoa AM STI ETC etc. ​2) Put your savings into CIMB fast saver 1% p.a  and earn easy interest​​Next, my personal though is that: 3) With your spending of $300-600 on groceries, food, entertainment, EZ-Link and M1 bills) If you can spend another $100 on something to make it $700, then apply BOC family visa card and get cash back on all the category: ​ => By spending on BOC family visa, you can get cash back of another $20 to $50 every month! More $$$ back for your bang!! ​  The BOC Family card cash back details and T&C: http://pic.bankofchina.com/bocappd/singapore/201803/P020180327710875490784.pdf0 comments1
Qinghui ChuaLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 17 Jun 2018POSB everyday card! Easier to earn the rebates and you dont need to worry about hitting the min spending.0 comments1

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 21 Sep 2018are you a miles chaser ? ​I think the DBS attitude Card is good for the no min spend + miles doesn’t expire. ​If miles are are not your thing then go with the posb Everyday Card spend 1 dollar on it.​Go for other Credit cards such as the UOB one or BOC that give you better cash rebates. 0 comments0
Serene TohLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 21 Sep 2018I vote for  POSB Everyday, since you use for groceries & bills.​Hmm, maybe you should try to set up a poll on facebook instead? :D0 comments0

Steph YeoLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 19 Jul 2018Live fresh card seems to be more helpful if you have alot of online spending, which doesn't seem to be the case. Check out seedly reviews or this valuepengiun overview of dbs cards? https://www.valuepenguin.sg/best-dbs-posb-credit-cards0 comments0
Chen Yong NgLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 16 Jun 2018POSB Everyday card as you have to hit minimum spend of 600 dollars for the cashback from DBS Live Fresh. 0 comments0

Hannah FooLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 15 Jun 2018I would recommend the POSB Everyday card. It allows you to offset the rebates earned against your monthly bill. I have both cards but use the POSB Everyday card as my default card0 comments0
